message.content:
cs.AR, cs.DS, cs.SY, cs.IT, cs.SE 

Reasoning: 
- cs.AR (Architecture): The paper proposes a new memory architecture that uses coding techniques to achieve multi-port memory performance on single-port memory. 
- cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms): The paper introduces a coding theoretic framework to encode data across multiple single-port memory banks, which involves designing efficient data structures and algorithms. 
- cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper proposes a memory controller design that utilizes redundancy across coded memory banks to more efficiently schedule read and write requests sent across multiple cores, which involves designing a control system. 
- cs.IT (Information Theory): The paper uses coding techniques to improve the efficiency of memory access, which is a core problem in information theory. 
- cs.SE (Software Engineering): The paper proposes a new memory design that can improve the performance of performance-critical systems, which is a software engineering problem.
